title: NewsBreak: U.S. Producer Prices Fall the Most in 8 Months in Sept
text:
NewsBreak: U.S. Producer Prices Fall the Most in 8 Months in Sept

Stock Markets 3 minutes ago (Oct 08, 2019 14:57)

© Reuters. Investing.com -- U.S. producer prices fell by the most in eight months in September, in further evidence of the slowdown hitting manufacturers across the country - and further afield. The data add to pressure on the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates again, in as much as producer prices are often a leading indicator of trends in consumer prices. fell by 0.3% on the month, the biggest drop since January. They haven't fallen by more since 2016. The fell to 1.4% from 1.8%, the lowest since December 2016 and below expectations for an unchanged reading. The data follow a bigger-than-expected drop in the index to 101.8 in October, from 103.1 in September. U.S. yield down 3 basis points vs Monday at 1.43% at $1.0991 vs $1.0984 before the news.

NewsBreak: U.S. Producer Prices Fall the Most in 8 Months in Sept
